pullRequest.title: [ML] job results provider refactoring
pullRequest.bodyText:
During a bug hunt, I caught a handful of things (unrelated to the bug) that could be potential issues:

Needlessly wrapping in exception handling (minor cleanup)
Potential of notifying listeners of a failure multiple times + even trying to notify of a success after a failure notification

nodes.bodyText: This was called assuming only one handler was called only once.

The only place where this method is used is in getAutodetectParams which is called when a job is opened. Any failure marked the job task as failed and attempted to close the job.
Problem was the potential of the callback being called numerous times. (see line 600)
If we opt to add returns when we signal a failure, then we might as well use that to simplify the code and remove those elses. Same holds for the added returns a bit lower.
Same as the my later comment. As we return now, we can simplify by not using else.

I know you didn't introduce this problem, but if this assertion error is ever thrown it will be frustrating because it will not say what the root case was.  So please can you change it to e -> { throw new AssertionError("Failure getting datafeed timing stats", e); }.
Is there an redundant indentation here or is it github messing with me?
